decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures and then use cards like Goryo's Vengeance to cheat them into play for a quick win. Faithful Mending and Ephemerate help to dig for combo pieces while protecting your life total. Atraxa, Grand Unifier can shut down opposing strategies while Psychic Frog provides additional graveyard fill and disruption. Solitude provides removal while also being a potential reanimation target. Overall, the goal of the deck is to efficiently reanimate high-impact creatures and control the game until victory.

The deck revolves around quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, using spells like Thoughtseize and Psychic Frog for disruption and control. Goryo's Vengeance is a key card to reanimate creatures from the graveyard, while cards like Ephemerate and Fallaji Archaeologist provide additional reanimation options. The deck aims to quickly bring back big threats and overwhelm the opponent with powerful combo plays, utilizing instant speed reanimation to keep the opponent off balance and ultimately secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with an aggressive strategy, utilizing efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Ocelot Pride. It also includes cards like Goblin Bombardment and Galvanic Discharge for additional damage output. The deck aims to control the board with cards like Blood Moon and Arena of Glory, while also generating card advantage with Vexing Bauble and Seasoned Pyromancer. The strategy is supported by powerful planeswalkers like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and finishers like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury. The deck aims to win the game quickly through creature damage and burn spells.

The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of aggressive creatures (such as Emperor of Bones and Overlord of the Balemurk) with disruptive spells (Fatal Push, Thoughtseize) to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. This deck aims to apply pressure to the opponent while also controlling the board with flicker effects like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp. The deck also includes powerful cards like Teferi, Time Raveler to further disrupt the opponent's strategy and maintain tempo.

This deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy, utilizing a mix of red, green, white, and blue cards to overwhelm the opponent quickly. With a combination of powerful creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Territorial Kavu, backed up by versatile spells like Lightning Bolt and Consign to Memory, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding help to support the aggressive game plan by providing additional boosts to creatures and disrupting the opponent's plans.

The deck focuses on assembling a variety of creatures that can be searched for and played using Chord of Calling to create a versatile toolbox. The combo aspect comes from using Sacrifice outlets like Carrion Feeder and Viscera Seer alongside creatures like Cauldron Familiar and Marionette Apprentice to generate value and drain your opponent's life. The deck also uses cards like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Boseiju, Who Endures to protect your combo pieces and disrupt your opponent's strategy. Overall, the strategy revolves around finding the right creatures at the right time to outvalue your opponent.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Solitude, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Emperor of Bones and Overlord of the Balemurk. The deck also utilizes flicker effects with cards like Flickerwisp and Ephemerate to gain additional value from enter-the-battlefield triggers. The mana base includes a mix of fetch lands and shock lands to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors. Ultimately, the goal is to control the board and drain your opponent's resources while maintaining a steady stream of threats.

The main focus of this UW Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy by utilizing counterspells, removal spells, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Narset, Parter of Veils. The deck aims to control the game by countering key spells, removing threats, and drawing advantage through card advantage and card selection. With a mix of control elements, card advantage engines, and disruptive planeswalkers, this deck aims to grind out opponents and eventually win through card advantage and incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on utilizing instant speed reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance to cheat powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Superior Spider-Man onto the battlefield. By combining creatures with unique abilities like Solitude, Psychic Frog, and Quantum Riddler, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt opponents' strategies. Teferi, Time Raveler provides additional protection and card advantage, while cards like Faithful Mending and Thoughtseize help dig for combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck's land base allows for flexibility and consistency in casting spells across different colors.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while quickly building up a board presence with aggressive creatures. The key strategy involves utilizing cards that have multiple effects, such as Ephemerate and Prismatic Ending, to control the board and protect your creatures. By combining disruptive spells with powerful creature abilities like Lifelink and protection from certain colors, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents through a combination of aggression and control. The deck's synergy between creatures and spells creates a versatile and adaptable playstyle that can catch opponents off guard.

The key strategy of this Amulet Titan deck is to efficiently ramp mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Sakura-Tribe Scout to quickly get out Primeval Titan and combo pieces like Scapeshift. By utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to untap lands and generate extra mana, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with powerful land combos, such as Vesuva copying important lands like Gruul Turf or Lotus Field. The deck also includes utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Ghost Quarter to disrupt opponents and protect its combo pieces.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful colorless spells and creatures while utilizing the UrzaTron lands to generate massive amounts of mana quickly. The strategy involves ramping up to play threats like Karn, the Great Creator, Thought-Knot Seer, and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms to disrupt the opponent's game plan and take over the game. The deck also includes removal spells like Dismember and Kozilek's Command to deal with threats, making it difficult for the opponent to establish a board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently reanimate powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Faithful Mending. The deck also utilizes instant spells like Solitude and Prismatic Ending for removal, as well as control elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The addition of cards like Ephemerate and Psychic Frog allows for card advantage and manipulation, while the mana base is designed to support the color requirements of the deck.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo using cards like Grinding Station, Agatha's Soul Cauldron, and Mox Amber to generate mana and card advantage. It utilizes various legends like Jace, Wielder of Mysteries, Kethis, the Hidden Hand, and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to enable the combo and win the game. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Malevolent Rumble to control the board and protect the combo. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game through a powerful synergistic interaction.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan with spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push. It also has a strong flicker theme, allowing for powerful enter-the-battlefield effects to be repeated multiple times with cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp. The deck aims to apply pressure early and continuously disrupt the opponent's board state, controlling the game while steadily chipping away at the opponent's life total.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play creatures such as Territorial Kavu and Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, supported by Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline Binding to control the board while dealing direct damage with Lightning Bolt. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle, utilizing cards like Stubborn Denial for protection and Consign to Memory for additional removal. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Scion of Draco and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury to secure victory.
